snippet: Saks reported a larger-than-expected second-quarter loss on Monday after disappointing sales of shoes and handbags forced it to reduce prices.
abstract: Saks reports larger-than-expected second-quarter loss after disappointing sales of shoes and handbags forced it to reduce prices; loss was $19.6 million, or 13 cents a share, compared with loss of $12.3 million, or 8 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; sales rose 0.5 percent to $707.8 million.
lead_paragraph: Saks reported a larger-than-expected second-quarter loss on Monday after disappointing sales of shoes and handbags forced it to reduce prices.

headline.main: Saks Losses Rise as Sales Fall Short of Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Saks Losses Rise as Sales Fall Short Of Forecasts
